subtitle: Thinking Allowed
Conversations on the Leading Edge of Knowledge
and Discovery with psychologist Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I'm Emmy Vadnais, co-host
with Jeffrey Mishlove. Our topic today is
global angelic spirituality. My guest is Normandi
Ellis, who's been interviewed twice before
on New Thinking Allowed. She is a spiritualist
minister, astrologer, and clairvoyant medium.
She is author of 14 books including Awakening Osiris,
The Spiritual Keys to the Egyptian Book of the
Dead, and Imagining the World into Existence, an
ancient Egyptian manual of consciousness. Her most
recent book is The Ancient Tradition of Angels,
The Power and Influence of Sacred Messengers.
Normandi is located in Frankfort, Kentucky. Now I'll switch over to the internet video.
Welcome, Normandi It is such a pleasure to be with you today.
Thank you. It's really great to be here and to meet you, Emmy.
You have explored ancient Egypt and what got
you interested in exploring angels more deeply?
I think I was always interested in angels. I grew
up around Catholic aunts and cousins and so on,
and was very fascinated with the angels that we
would pray to. But I think what mostly got me
interested in doing this particular book on angels
is that I became a minister, a spiritualist minister,
and someone asked me one time, what is that? And I
said, it's like, well, when you're a reverend in a
spiritualist church, you marry them, bury them,
and then you bring them back. And so we have a
garden of prayer that has busts of the major prophets of the religions.
And the thing that I realized as I was teaching more
and more about this is that angels, a belief in angels
is what connects every single religion. And we are a spiritualist or unity of religion.
And so I thought there's more to this than just these busts out here in the garden.
And so I started to study it. Now, that said, I've
also had some angelic encounters that I didn't always
quite know what they were. But that led me to want to do a book on angels.
Yeah, you mentioned how when you were younger that
you started to have visions or experience a connection
to God's wife, who you later found to have a connection to Egypt.
Yes, yes. She came knocking at our door one time in the middle of an ice storm.
And I could hear her calling outside. And so
I went and entered the door and there she was.
And I asked her to come in and I told my
mother, well, we need to make her some coffee.
And my mother said, well, who is this? And I said,
it's God's wife. She calls herself the Ice Queen.
And later I realized it was Isis as I got older. But mom was all for it.
She was like, grew up Catholic. It's like, OK, come on in.
She fixes a cup of coffee for the Ice Queen and
begins to ask her questions, which I answer for her
because she can't hear the Ice Queen. So I began to give her the answers.
It was really quite interesting. I was about six, maybe five or six.
So that was my first experience with Isis and the Ice Queen and angels in general.
And what did she communicate to you?
My mother would say, well, can you see me? And Isis would say yes.
She would say, do you know everything about me?
And Isis, the Ice Queen said, of course I do.
You know, I know how much your father in
heaven loves you. You know, things like that.
Yeah, it was a very comforting and beautiful conversation because
my mother was kind of going through a hard time at that time.
When did you discover that connection that that was Isis?
Probably when I was in college and I was translating hieroglyphs.
And this was a process of looking at the hieroglyphs for a class in translation.
And what would happen is that I would study and study and
study and look at these copy books and copy things over
and then fall asleep on top of them. And then when I woke
up, I would hear this voice in my head saying what it meant.
And so I would copy it down. And so I guess you would say they were trans-channeled.
You know, some people asked me if they were channeled and I denied it
for a long time because it took a lot of studying to get to that point.
But you have to study to get the information in your head so
that they can use it, you know, and channel it through you.
And of course, there's always the image of Isis as the winged being.
She's on my necklace here, you'll see. Isis as the winged being.
And she appears with her sister, you know, on the Ark of the Covenant.
So they're leaning over like this and their wings are wrapped around them.
And it's Isis and Nephthys. And they are the exact same
images as the angels that appear on the Ark of the Covenant.
And I made that connection like, oh, well, that's where they came from.
The Egyptians and the Jews lived so close together for such a long period of time,
it wasn't always that they had their family disagreement, if you will.
But yeah, they incorporated a lot of what they learned in ancient
Egypt, including those two angels on the Ark of the Covenant.
And what are they doing on the Covenant?
The same thing. That box that contains all the sacred things of the Jewish history,
they are sitting on top of that box protecting it.
It's not supposed to be opened.
And the same image appears in ancient Egypt as
these two goddesses protecting the coffin of Osiris.
And so that's the connection.
That seems to be a theme among many angels, is that they are protectors.
They are protectors. They take care of us. They
have three jobs, actually. Angels have three jobs.
One of them is protection of humanity.
Another is the moving back and forth, up and down the ladder, if you will,
Jacob's ladder from heaven to earth, delivering messages.
And the other one is to sing God's praises.
And so those are their three main functions.
Now, they also have three appearances.
They appear sometimes as humans, like those angels that showed up to Abraham
and told him, look, something bad's going down. They ate like men.
You know, Sarah fixed them something to eat. They sat under the tree.
And they said to Abraham, something's going
down with your cousins in Gomorrah and Sodom.
And we need to get your cousins out of there
because God has decided that those folks
are not doing what they should do and God's going to destroy their city.
And so they delivered that message to Abraham and he
said, OK, I'll go with you and we'll go and get them.
So the angels go to, I think it was Gomorrah where Lot lived.
And yeah, it was very, you know, there was a lot of
sexual promiscuity and things like that going on.
And none of the people in the city were safe, none of the women.
And so Lot had had sort of locked himself inside his house.
But Lot's wife, we don't know her name. I call her Lottie.
So she would go out and, you know, see the people
and then come back and, you know, live her life.
But she kind of liked it there.
And he had two daughters, I think, that
were with this, you know, Lott and his wife.
And so the angels come and say, your whole family, you
know, we're going to destroy the city and you need to leave.
And his wife, of course, did not want to go.
And the angels, it was kind of interesting, the angels came
in and the people in the city were banging on the door going,
Who are those beautiful men? Tell them to come out. We would like to see them.
You know, and he's like, no, we're not, we're not opening the door.
They almost got in and he said, here, I'll give you my daughters.
Well, those people banging on the door were not interested in women.
They were interested in the beautiful men.
So finally they escape. And the angel says, don't look back, you know, have no regrets.
When you make a change in your life, that's the basic message.
Do not look back. And I've taken this story a lot to my life.
When you make a big change, don't look back.
You know, it's for your own interest.
So they leave and Mrs. Lott looks back and turns into a pillar of salt.
So that's one of the stories. They appear as men.
You know, they appear almost as mortal men.
Now, sometimes angels will come and they'll be of the winged variety,
the kind that appear flying in the sky when to announce the birth of Christ.
And that's usually when you see that the people are kind of freaked out.
They're like, oh, my God, there's men flying in the sky.
You know, what in the world is going on? And that's the angels.
Okay. And they're the beautiful winged ones.
And the other angels are the kind of angels that Ezekiel saw in his vision.
And they are basically geometric shapes that go winging about the sky.
They have eyes on these geometric shapes and they're quite frightening.
Some of them have multiple heads, you know.
So the angels can take whatever shape gives the most drama to their appearance.
I'll say that.
And that we might be able to see or hear based on our own current consciousness.
Exactly.
You share a story in your book about Cokeville
and children who claim to have seen angels who saved their lives.
There were two people who came to this Mormon community in Cokeville.
They decided that the Mormons must be rich
and they were going to try to get a million dollars per child.
So they were basically going to kill them
all unless they were given a million dollars.
So they come to the school and they walk into the school
and there's a shopping cart that's filled with explosives of all sorts.
And they are sitting in the middle of the school room
and the teachers and the students hear a voice that
tells them to move over to the side of the room.
And so they do and they stand there.
The countdown begins.
The police and everybody around.
But there's enough explosives in that shopping
cart to level four or five city blocks.
They negotiate for a while.
Nobody's coming in, nobody's going out.
Finally the guy has to go to the bathroom.
So he ties the string to the explosives, the key around his wife's hand, her wrist,
while he goes to the bathroom outside the building.
And she sits there and the children are talking out loud.
They're conversing with these beings of light.
They are either angels or they are...
Some of them are described as with dark hair, dark curly hair,
and another described the person who talked
to her as white hair with blue eyes and so on.
And so they were described by the children who survived to their family members.
And the family members kind of recognized that as being,
oh, that looks like grandma.
Oh, that looks like my aunt so-and-so, my great aunt so-and-so.
But there were also just these beings of light.
So what happens while this woman is sitting there tied to the explosives
waiting for her husband to come back is her nose itches.
And she goes like this and pulls the string when she goes like this and it blows.
Now the miracle of it is that when it blows, the explosives go straight up.
They were meant to go out, but they go straight up.
Of course the woman dies immediately.
And as explosives go up, these angels all say,
come amid the smoke and lead the teachers and the children out of the room.
And so later they're asking that everybody
survives except for the woman and her husband.
The police are asking them, how did you know where to go?
And they said, oh, well, you know, this woman with dark curly hair
grabbed my hand and she led me out and I grabbed
my brother and sister's hands and out we went.
Another one would say, oh, you know, this woman with white hair and blue eyes
came and said, go this way, go this way.
And I followed her.
And the people were listening to the kids' descriptions
and they started to go back into their family books
and realized that these were ancestors of each person
who had come for their grandchildren to lead them out.
And the other description they gave was that the beings of light
all stood around in a circle around the shopping cart as it was going off.
And when it blew, they put their wings out and it blew straight up instead of out.
And the angels went up with them.
So that's really quite an amazing story of the angels and the ancestors.
Now, after I tell that story, people say, well, when people die, are they angels?
And from my understanding of Thomas Aquinas
and other writers who've written on the topic,
is that they say that angels and ancestors live on the same plane,
but ancestors are not angels.
Angels are like a separate being, the same way cats are like a separate being.
They're still spiritual beings.
They're still beings of light, but they're not the same.
The belief in divine messengers is a tenet in every religion around the globe.
It is. Yeah.
Where it began, I have no idea, but in my book,
I start with the three great religions that were begun by Abraham.
Judaism and Christianity and Islam.
And so those three all have Abraham as their great prophet.
And so we talk about that and the connections and the similarities
and the dissimilarities between those.
And then we ask the question, where did that come from?
And we start following a little trick along
the trail of religions, along the Silk Road.
And that's where the Zoroastrianism comes into it.
That's where the Yazidis or Yazadis are part of that Manichaean.
So a lot of religions that are no longer are part of that whole mix.
And that Silk Road goes all the way to China and India.
So we include the Buddhists and the Hindus as part of that as well.
And though they don't call them angels, they call them devas.
But they are the same beings who are spiritual
in the air, you know, related to divinity.
Sadly, when people try to denounce those
religions, they'll say, oh, those are not angels.
They're devils, as in deva and devil being of the same language.
But it's not true.
They share a lot of similarities with the
Christian angels and the Abrahamic tradition.
What similarities and differences did you find
among these spiritual traditions and cultures?
Well, one of the things that was quite interesting is that we
have hierarchies of angels that appear in Christian tradition.
I'm saying we because I was raised as a Christian.
And so the Christian tradition has hierarchies of angels.
They exist on nine planes and they exist on nine planes
or seven planes in the Hindu and Buddhist traditions.
In the Yazidi tradition, there are seven planes of angels that
accompany their I guess we'll call him that their high angel,
their divine creator angel, whose name is Tawûsî Melek.
And he's a peacock angel. He has all the colors of the earth.
And he's kind of like their great ancestor.
They believe that they are the children of Tawûsî Melek.
Now, that alone will make some people say that they're devils.
But my understanding is that we are all part
of God's creatures because even in the Bible,
God makes the angels and then he makes humans and he says we have made men.
We have made them like us.
OK, so like the angels like their divine beings made of light.
OK, and that's and that's something that you find in every single
religion that the angels, the devas are divine beings made of light.
They may be winged or they may fly through the
air with these scarves that float, you know,
but they fly through the air and they are as close to us as thought.
That's the other thing that comes up. They are as close to us as thought.
Now that the idea of thought being connected to the angels.
Now, let me back up. I like this quote by Mary Oliver who says the
only time you'll ever see an angel is if you have one in your mind,
then you'll see it. If you believe in them, you'll see it.
They are close as thought, OK, because they are made of light.
And we also, as we're learning now, are made of light. We are beings made of light.
The electrons in the DNA and the things that move around
inside our bodies are these electrical things, sensations.
We're living electrical light and that's what the angels are.
They're less form, but they're still living electrical light.
And the thing about we're kind of leaping into the end of the book.
But the thing about the quanta question is when you're
looking at light and you're trying to decide how does it move?
What does it do? It moves according to thought.
We know about the double slit theory where they shoot lasers
through the little slit and try to figure out, try to follow it.
When their consciousness is following the light, it's in a straight line.
But when it's no longer looking at it, it disperses.
So it's like thought is what creates the form. That's what they discovered.
And other things that they've discovered about the quality of light
is if any two things have ever existed together as one thing,
if they are separated, they still resonate with each other.
OK, so that's how humans and angels work together.
I think it was Meister Eckhart who said that the
angels are no further away from us than a thought.
They could be at the edge of the universe.
And yet you think you're driving down the road and
you're thinking, oh, my God, there's a car coming.
Help me, Michael. You know, and all of a sudden the car is diverted.
You know, it won't happen every time. Right.
But that's kind of how that works. It's the thought that brings the energy to you.
Is it the same Michael? Is there only one Michael? No.
No, it's the energy of Michael.
And so all of the energies that have Michael's
light signature are available to you.
It then begs the question of that continuum of
consciousness of what are the angels and what are us?
Yeah, well, it does beg the question.
And I guess we won't know until we're living
on the astral plane, how close we are to them.
To answer that, I'll tell you about a dream I had. Please. Yeah.
I had this dream one night that I was up in heaven or wherever the other plane is.
And I was standing around this kind of bubbly little cauldron.
And there were plates, colored plates of glass floating around on the top of it.
And some of them were triangles and some of them were
squares and some of them were hexagons and so on.
And I was standing around there with all these other light beings.
And I recognized that all those other light beings were angels.
And we're looking at these plates sort of, you know,
slowly moving around across the top of the water,
almost like if you had dropped oil inside a
boiling pot on the stove and it just moves around.
And so I was looking at all the
configurations that those plates were making,
realizing, as I did so, that these were astrological configurations.
Like sometimes they were trines, which is a good aspect.
Sometimes they were squares, which is a difficult aspect that has to be overcome.
Sometimes they were conjunct, floating over top
of each other, sometimes sextiles and so on.
And so I said, is this someone's chart?
And the angels said, yes, we're looking at someone's chart.
And I said, oh, this is exciting. I'm helping to make someone's chart.
And so I keep looking at these things and I say, oh, well,
that's going to mean this and this is going to mean that.
And oh, that's going to be a difficult thing to overcome.
But look, there's all this beauty over here on this other side.
And I said to them, this is the most amazing chart.
Whoever this is for is going to be so blessed.
And one of the angels goes, jump in.
And I realized I had been looking at my own astrological
chart that the angels and I had created together.
It was kind of interesting.
Yeah, that is an incredible story.
Yeah. So when I woke up, I thought, oh, that's how it
works, you know, and that we are living languages of light.
That's what we are.
All the things that happen to us, all the molecules and the, you know, DNA and
everything that's moving around inside our bodies is a living language of light.
Those angels were helping to prepare the destiny or at
least a path of the potentialities your life might take.
Yes, yes, they were.
And had you been studying astrology at that point, or was that
what kind of tipped you into your interest with that subject?
Oh, I've been studying astrology for a while.
I've been studying astrology for years, but I
didn't know the angels were choreographing it.
You describe that humans have free will, but angels do not.
Is that something you discovered to be consistent
among various traditions around the world?
I do discover it to be somewhat consistent.
And people will ask me, well, why don't angels have free will?
And it's kind of like, I don't know, maybe they did at one time.
But if you were an angel and you disobeyed God and God cast you out of heaven,
you know, your brothers and sisters would go, well, we're not going to do that.
So I think it's kind of along those lines.
They probably could revolt if they wanted, but they know what will happen.
They will leave heaven.
They will be as if they had never existed.
And so they choose not to.
Let's just say they don't use any type of will.
OK, if you pray to an angel, you know, it's like, angel, please do this for me.
The angel can't do it for you.
The angel will take the message to God and God will give
the message back to the angel who will give it to you.
But the angel, him or her or itself will not be the one doing the deed.
Going back to the concept of angels being light, there are reports, like you mentioned
in that story previously, of people who see angels as how we see each other physically.
Some people will see them as you have in dreams.
Some people might hear messages and others might see orbs or light.
So why such the variety of ways we can perceive them?
Because there are so many ways that we have of perceiving reality.
You and I can look at something the same
thing and not necessarily see the same thing.
Having been trained as a clairvoyant, some people who
are giving messages are giving what they hear, you know.
Some people are seeing symbols and giving
messages based on the symbols that they're seeing.
Others have physical impressions like, you know, you can feel it on your body.
This hair on your arms will raise up when you're in the presence of spirit.
So there are a lot of different ways, depending
upon what kind of antenna we're born with, I think.
Again, that story that you shared, I
imagine some of our listeners are wondering,
Well, I pray to angels and why are some people

First and foremost, the energy of being saved by angels is or rescued by angels.
It comes from the divine.
Okay, so if you pray to God, like, please don't
let me, you know, hit that pole over there.
You're talking to God, you're not necessarily talking to
an angel, but God will send an angel down to help you.
Example, I was driving down the road and I don't know
if it's exactly a prayer, but we'll call it that.
I'm driving down the road one day on the interstate
and this truck comes by and moves over into my lane
and he moves over right on top of me and he pushes me into

I can hear him hitting my car.
I see the the side view mirror go flying off my

and I'm and I'm holding on to the steering wheel
going, Oh God, Oh God, Oh God, Oh God, Oh God, Oh God.
I guess that's a prayer.
Finally, I managed to stop, you know, in the medium without flipping over.
I get out of the car and the minute I step my foot down

And I think to myself, I had an angel, you
know, that helped me to hang on while I could
and then guided me over to a safe spot and left a little signature for me.
And it's like, thank you, thank you.
There are stories about people who try to use angels.
There's a story about that's told by the history of
Eleazar Ben-Judah of Worms, who was a rabbi in the mid
centuries, you know, middle ages.
He had some students.
He was this Jewish rabbi and he had some students who were studying with him

town to meet some friends who were, you know,
and it was like they had to go through a bad part of the woods.
And he said, Don't go there.
And they said, Oh, well, we'll be fine.
And he said, Well, don't use the angels to try to make yourself safe, you know.
And so they said, Oh, we won't.
So they go over to the other side of town and sure

And so they invoke the angels to try to keep them from being harmed.
And the angels so frightened the robbers when they appear that they flee.
And so they go over to the other side and have
their meeting with their friends and come back.
And they're all ha ha ha.
Look what we did.
We saved ourselves through the angels.
And Eleazar goes, No, that's not what they're for.
So they can do it, but that's not what they're for.
And you are abusing their power.
He said, I want to I want you to go back to that side of town and use no angels.
And they said, OK, so they go back to that side of town and they were murdered.
So it was like proof.
You can't use them for, you know, things that you shouldn't be using them for.
So that's basically a story about that.
The misuse of the power of angels.
I think that's kind of cruel for him to send

But it was like I made a point to the other students, I suppose.
And what have you discovered is the, shall we say, proper use of an angel or angels?
Let's start with what's the proper use of prayer.
OK, so what's the proper use of prayer?
The proper use of prayer is thankfulness, is gratitude.
The story is that the most important prayer that angels ever

And so they are praising God.
That is their most important thing is to say,

and to bless the whole world with the light of their prayers.
I think that angels, if we would say, what are they used for?
I think the proper term is that we shouldn't

That we should think of them as being there to provide us protection when we need it.
The guardian angels around my bed.
That's not saying, you know, keep the devils away.

You just thank them for being there.
You're just thanking them for being there.
OK, that's the proper use of an angel is to thank it
for being there and for singing the praises of God.
Did you read the story about Tobit and Tobias?
Yes.
That angel was simply meant to accompany a young man on his way to meet his bride.

Tobias said, no, no, no, no.
No, Tobit said, no, no, I don't want my son to marry

And she's horrible.
All of her husbands have died.
She's just a black widow.
And, you know, she's going to kill him and take all my money.

So this angel, Gabriel, walks with this boy to

And it's a very happy marriage and very long lasting marriage.
And what he does is he is the angel of healing.

You know, he's sort of a misanthropist or something.

And so he's kind of a misogynist.
And so he's healed of being a misogynist by having his son

And the young boy is given the gift of a beautiful wife and a beautiful home.
And the woman that he marries is healed from this

And the truth is revealed that they were

So anyway, he healed three people just by walking with

The father didn't even ask for it and the girl didn't ask for it.
But he made sure that everyone was healed by

And that's what an angel should do.
Many of us humans are learning that more deeply as we go forward.
In your studies and research, and I just want to add that your book is your really

Yeah, it is. I wouldn't have written about angels except for my dissertation

How many angels there are and types of angels

Well, there's so many angels, you know, they

Yes, you know, I don't think we can possibly

There is a wonderful book, which was one of my

And that was by a guy named Davidson. And he didn't start out to study the angels.
He started out to find out which angels he could use in his

And so he studied every angel he could get his

One of the ones, sometimes they just rise up and announce themselves,

Like Edgar Cayce introduced us to an angel named Halaliel.

And Michael was always giving them messages of love and

So Cayce goes into a trance and he channels this angel
